1.text: Doth not wisdom call? And understanding give forth her voice?

2.text: At the head of high places by the way, Between the paths she hath stood,

3.text: At the side of the gates, at the mouth of the city, The entrance of the openings, she crieth aloud,

4.text: Unto you, O men, I call, And my voice is unto the sons of men.

5.text: Understand, ye simple ones, prudence, And ye fools, understand the heart,

6.text: Hearken, for noble things I speak, And the opening of my lips is uprightness.

7.text: For truth doth my mouth utter, And an abomination to my lips is wickedness.

8.text: In righteousness are all the sayings of my mouth, Nothing in them is froward and perverse.

9.text: All of them are plain to the intelligent, And upright to those finding knowledge.

10.text: Receive my instruction, and not silver, And knowledge rather than choice gold.

11.text: For better is wisdom than rubies, Yea, all delights are not comparable with it.

12.text: I, wisdom, have dwelt with prudence, And a knowledge of devices I find out.

13.text: The fear of Jehovah is to hate evil; Pride, and arrogance, and an evil way, And a froward mouth, I have hated.

14.text: Mine is counsel and substance, I am understanding, I have might.

15.text: By me kings reign, and princes decree righteousness,

16.text: By me do chiefs rule, and nobles, All judges of the earth.

17.text: I love those loving me, And those seeking me earnestly do find me.

18.text: Wealth and honour are with me, Lasting substance and righteousness.

19.text: Better is my fruit than gold, even fine gold, And mine increase than choice silver.

20.text: In a path of righteousness I cause to walk, In midst of paths of judgment,

21.text: To cause my lovers to inherit substance, Yea, their treasures I fill.

22.text: Jehovah possessed me—the beginning of His way, Before His works since then.

23.text: From the age I was anointed, from the first, From former states of the earth.

24.text: In there being no depths, I was brought forth, In there being no fountains heavy with waters,

25.text: Before mountains were sunk, Before heights, I was brought forth.

26.text: While He had not made the earth, and out-places, And the top of the dusts of the world.

27.text: In His preparing the heavens I am there, In His decreeing a circle on the face of the deep,

28.text: In His strengthening clouds above, In His making strong fountains of the deep,

29.text: In His setting for the sea its limit, And the waters transgress not His command, In His decreeing the foundations of earth,

30.text: Then I am near Him, a workman, And I am a delight—day by day. Rejoicing before Him at all times,

31.text: Rejoicing in the habitable part of His earth, And my delights are with the sons of men.

32.text: And now, ye sons, hearken to me, Yea, happy are they who keep my ways.

33.text: Hear instruction, and be wise, and slight not.

34.text: O the happiness of the man hearkening to me, To watch at my doors day by day, To watch at the door-posts of my entrance.

35.text: For whoso is finding me, hath found life, And bringeth out good-will from Jehovah.

36.text: And whoso is missing me, is wronging his soul, All hating me have loved death!
